document_name_accent: ung thu buong trung giai doan 4.json
document_title: Stage 4 ovarian cancer: Symptoms, treatment and prognosis
subsection_content:
Late-stage cancer often has typical signs and symptoms because at this point the disease has become more severe and has metastasized to other organs in the body, causing pain for the patient. According to MSc. Luu Thao Ngoc, patients with stage IV ovarian cancer may experience some symptoms such as:
Systemic symptoms: fatigue, poor appetite, weight loss, pale skin, ascites,...; Abdominal and pelvic pain: cramping pain in the lower abdomen and pelvis; Pleural effusion: chest tightness and difficulty breathing due to cancer cells metastasizing to the pleura.; Neurological symptoms due to metastatic cancer such as: headaches, nausea, epilepsy, weakness...; Bone and joint pain: due to cancer metastasis to bones.; Intestinal obstruction: abdominal pain, nausea, bowel obstruction; Venous thrombosis: hypercoagulable condition causing thrombosis in limb veins,...
Abdominal and pelvic pain occurs continuously, with increasing severity, causing patients to quickly become physically weak, depressed, and mentally depressed.
subsection_title: ung thu buong trung giai doan 4.json. Symptoms of stage IV ovarian cancer
